Organs/Tissues: Human upper airway epithelium (nasal, tracheal, bronchial) at ALI
Physiological/Pathological: Both—healthy donors (non-smoker or smoker) and diseased donors (COPD, asthma, cystic fibrosis, allergic rhinitis)
Cell Source: Primary human airway epithelial cells (low-passage), fully differentiated in a pseudostratified ALI culture
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (basal, goblet, ciliated). Fibroblasts optional in MucilAir-HF
Tissue-resident Immune: No standard. Alveolar macrophages can be co-cultured (immune kit)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No, single epithelial model unless fibroblasts/immune added
Air-Liquid Interface: Yes, essential for mucociliary function and aerosol studies
Extracellular Matrix: Minimal (membrane + cell-secreted basement); fibroblasts in HF version deposit ECM
3D Scaffold: No external 3D scaffold; forms a 3D layered epithelium on flat Transwell
Notable Features: Long-term viability (up to 1 year), ciliated with mucus, broad disease coverage, widely used for inhalation toxicity & infection
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (basal medium, apical wash for mucus/infectious agents)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes (enzymatic dissociation or lysis for RNA/protein)
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator level, can do aerosol/gas exposure on apical side
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Manual changes only, no automated flow

Organs/Tissues: Human small airway (bronchiolar) epithelium at ALI
Physiological/Pathological: Both—healthy, smoker, COPD, asthma donors. Optional CF donors upon request
Cell Source: Primary human small-airway epithelial cells (distal bronchioles), low passage
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (basal, club/Clara, ciliated, minimal goblet). Fibroblasts optional in SmallAir-HF
Tissue-resident Immune: No standard. Alveolar macrophages can be co-cultured
Air-Liquid Interface: Yes, crucial for club cell & cilia function
Extracellular Matrix: Membrane + cell-secreted basement; fibroblasts in HF add ECM
3D Scaffold: No external 3D scaffold; forms thin pseudostratified layer on Transwell
Notable Features: Club cells (CC10 secretion), ciliated, stable for months, less mucus than MucilAir
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (basal medium; apical washes for secretions/pathogens)
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator or external aerosol device on apical side

Organs/Tissues: Human alveolar epithelium (Type I & II) + capillary endothelium co-culture
Physiological/Pathological: Primarily healthy donors (physiological alveolar barrier); can induce pathologies (infection, injury)
Cell Source: Primary alveolar type II pneumocytes & lung microvascular endothelial cells on opposite sides of membrane
Stromal Cells: No. Fibroblasts not included in base model
Tissue-resident Immune: No. Alveolar macrophages can be added (triple co-culture)
Circulating Immune: None integrated; possible to introduce immune cells on endothelium side
Air-Liquid Interface: Yes, epithelial side exposed to air, endothelium submerged
Extracellular Matrix: Thin microporous membrane with ECM coating, cells form fused basement membrane
3D Scaffold: No external scaffold, a 2D bilayer forming alveolus–capillary barrier
Notable Features: Stable alveolar co-culture with surfactant secretion (ATII), high TEER, used for influenza/SARS-CoV-2 infection
Plate/Format (Throughput): Transwell inserts in 24-well plate. Low–medium throughput
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (confocal, TEER-based studies). Complex to image both sides simultaneously
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (apical for alveolar side, basal for endothelial/blood side)
Perfused: Not standard. Static endothelium side. Could adapt to flow in custom setups
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator environment; alveolar side open to air. Can do aerosol infection
